partyName: Indian National Congress & Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi
summary: Congress says it plans to tackle Mumbai's worsening air pollution with stronger controls and better urban planning, introduce universal health cards so residents can access free medicines and public healthcare without hassle, and reform the BMC to make it transparent and corruption-free, while significantly improving everyday civic services like roads, water supply, sanitation, and overall quality of life for Mumbaikars.
keyPromises: Tackle air pollution with stronger controls
Universal health cards for free medicines

summary: Mahayuti (BJP, Shiv Sena, and RPI-A) presents a comprehensive vision for Mumbai to be Clean, Green, Safe, Fast, Sustainable, Prosperous, and Happy. The manifesto emphasizes world-class infrastructure, 24x7 water supply, AI-powered education and healthcare, and robust women's empowerment through financial support and safety initiatives.

partyName: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray), Maharashtra Navnirman Sena & NCP (Sharad Pawar)
summary: The alliance pledges 1 lakh affordable homes and ensures no municipal land goes to private developers. A major focus is on women's welfare with ₹1,500/month for domestic workers and 'Masaheb Kitchens' serving ₹10 meals. The manifesto promises free electricity (100 units), property tax waivers for homes up to 700 sq ft, and extensive education reforms including multi-board schools and digital learning. Infrastructure plans include 100% sewer coverage, new electric buses with affordable fares, and restoring Mumbai's status as a global financial hub.

summary: AAP's 'Kejriwalchi Guarantee' for Mumbai promises to replicate its Delhi model with free basic services and world-class public infrastructure. Key pillars include free 24x7 water supply, zero electricity bills up to 200 units, establishing 1,000 Mohalla Clinics for free primary healthcare, and revolutionizing BMC schools with modern facilities. The manifesto also addresses women's safety with free bus travel and financial support, alongside a commitment to corruption-free governance.
